_header: Jesu that all this world hath wrought
Subjects: sermons, verse in; prayers, to Christ; Christ, prayers to; roundels
_description: A prayer to Jesus for mercy occurring in a Latin homily — thirty-six lines in irregular stanzas, possibly a round

OxfMert248.First Lines:
Ihesu þat made þis world haþ wroȝthaue merci on
                    me…
OxfMert248.Last Lines:
…haue merci on me& bring me to þeþat wolde
                    ben at teþat longeþ to þein þi muchel
                    blisþat neuer more shal blinne
OxfMert248.Note:
Written as prose in two passages interrupted by Latin
                    prose.
OxfMert248.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque
                oxoniensibus….
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1852: 96.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 51-2.
